feed.title: SAP Community - ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model
feed.subtitle: ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Draft Enabled RAP Object with association [0..*]
entry.content:
Hi,

we are seeing this strange behavior that seems to be a bug. We have developed a draft enabled managed BO.  This object has the following associations. Both of these associations are not part of object hierarchy.

association [0..1] to I_OfferType_VH as _Type on $projection.OfferType = _Type.OfferType
association [0..*] to C_OfferBUList as _BUList on $projection.OfferUUID = _BUList.OfferUUID

The first association is a simple case of type for a document. So when we modify the draft value, the association uses this draft value to determine new value of _Type. This works as expected. User changes the object property and the new values are immediately shown to the user. 

The problem is with the second association. Here we have an association to many ([0..*]). Based on the value of the root entity property, we determine a list of subsequent objects. The current value of draft is being ignored and the logic to resolve data of association is still using the value from the original object. Once the draft gets saved, it starts fetching the correct values. This is too late for us. In other words, the property value gets changed on draft but the corresponding association is still showing relevant entities resolved with the original value. 

Why does draft enablement work fine for association with [0..1] but does not work properly with [0..*]? Is this a limitation of Draft implementation or a bug? It seems like a bug to me.

The stack is ABAP Platform 2023.

entry.title: Yet another "Unspecified provider error occurred. See Error Context and Call Stack."
entry.content:
Hello experts.

I try to learn abap rap. To have something to play I created simple managed service listing persons detail (name, phone, gender etc.). I created action decreaseBirthdate which decrease birth date of selected person by 1 year (for whatever reason you can imagine). When I run the action on multiple persons (OData V4), it works as expected. When I select only one person (OData V2/V4), the change is saved in db but frontend shows message "Unspecified provider error occurred. See Error Context and Call Stack.".

 

So far I figured out that: 

  • for multiple selections the back-end runs 3 times method  /iwbep/if_v4_dp_advanced~read_entity_list( ) and then returns to front-end which is OK
  • for a single selection the back-end does same things as mentioned above but after that for some reason it calls /iwbep/if_v4_dp_advanced~read_entity( ) which leads to mentioned error.

Any idea how to overcome the issue? 

The code can be inspected on TRL/100 under zrapstudy package.

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Need help in implementing "Multiple value selection" into "Value Help CDS view"
entry.content:
Hello Team,

I have requirement in SAP Public Cloud as follows –

I have implemented one CDS view Z_I_MATDOC_VH for value help for the standard field in which I’m fetching data from standard CDS view I_MaterialDocumentHeader_2. I have implemented necessary annotations in this custom CDS view.

There is another CDS  view Z_I_SELCTION for input selection. It has got 3 fields as follows –

-CompanyCode

-MaterialDocument

-MaterialDocumentYear

I’m using CDS view Z_I_MATDOC_VH into annotation -@Consumption.valueHelpDefinition : [{ entity: { name: ‘Z_I_MATDOC_VH’,

Element: ‘MaterialDocument’}}]

I’m also using annotation - @Consumption.filter.multipleSelection: true

The system is giving proper value help for field ‘MaterialDocument’.

But I’m able to select only one value from it.

My requirement is to select Multiple Values from the entries of Value Help.
Please help me with your suggestions and code snippets.

entry.title: RAP error after refresh custom object page with multi input component inside a table
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
the fiori App I'm working on, serve as a replacement of transaction VK11/VK12.
In the following example, we created 3 conditions record, two with only project milestone as condition key and the other with milestone and materials as key:
 

 

 
The field materials is a multi input component:
 

 

 
items table(milestones) and materials are two RAP entities with the following association:
 

 

Basically the two entities are zeta table:

 

 

the table field after the wbs element (ParentConditionRecord) is the link to the milestones table/entity together with the milestone number:

 

Keys for Material entity:

 

Keys for Milestone entity:

The problem arise when I try to add another condition for a different material through the button duplicate row:

 

In my custom controller we have:

 

​after pressing the save button, we have the following:

 

 

 

 


 

The error happens when I call the action to refresh the UI:

(the action has side effects so it cannot be static, that means we need a context to invoke the action on).

the action response is correct:

 {"@odata.etag":"W/\"SADL-000000000000000000000C~0.0000000\"","ProjectMilestone":"4938","ConditionRecord":"0000344090","WbsI":"6302","Wbs":"HQ01C3C911","UsageCode":"ZIPA","UsageCodeName":"PROVISIONAL ACCEPTANCE CERTIFICATE","Mapping":"ZIPA","ConditionTypeName":"PAC","ConditionType":"ZIPA","BasicFixDate":null,"PaymentTerm":"0001","MatGrp2":"","Percentage":"2.00","ConditionText":"","Amount":"0.00","RecordCreationDate":"2025-09-26T09:32:37.612937Z","_Materials":[{"projectmilestone":"4938","material":"HQ01C3C903004850","ConditionRecord":"0000344090"}]}

 

If I force a browser refresh, everything works correctly:

the response is the same as the action's one:

{"@odata.etag":"W/\"SADL-000000000000000000000C~0.0000000\"","ProjectMilestone":"4938","ConditionRecord":"0000344090","WbsI":"6302","Wbs":"HQ01C3C911","UsageCode":"ZIPA","UsageCodeName":"PROVISIONAL ACCEPTANCE CERTIFICATE","Mapping":"ZIPA","ConditionTypeName":"PAC","ConditionType":"ZIPA","BasicFixDate":null,"PaymentTerm":"0001","MatGrp2":"","Percentage":"2.00","ConditionText":"","Amount":"0.00","RecordCreationDate":"2025-09-26T09:32:37.612937Z","_Materials":[{"projectmilestone":"4938","material":"HQ01C3C903004850","ConditionRecord":"0000344090"}]}

 

Any help is greatly appreciated,

regards

Filippo.

entry.title: Disable the multi line edit in SAP RAP application in Edit Mode
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

Working with S/4 HANA 2023 FPS03 version.

In an SAP RAP-based Fiori Elements LROP application with oData V4 version, there are two Object Pages involved.

List Report - Displays a list of Objects,  First Object Page - Upon selecting an object from the list, this page a table with line items related to child entities, based on the keys from the parent CDS view.

In the table toolbar on the First Object Page, there will be a Create button (enabled via an association with Create from Parent in the Behavior Definition). Clicking this button navigates to the Second Object Page for creation or update of the line items.

When users click Edit on the First Object Page, all the line items in the table become editable via multi-line edit. However, the requirement is to disable this multi-line edit functionality in the table on the First Object Page. Instead, users should:

Use the Create button to navigate to the Second Object Page to add new line items.

Click on individual rows in the table to navigate to the Second Object Page for updating existing items.

Kindly suggest, how to disable the multi line edit in Edit Mode. Any suggestions, really appreciate it.

Regards,
Venkatesh K

Hint: ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA #Core Data Services (CDS)

entry.title: How to consume APIs in custom RAP application for SAP public cloud(3SL)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am currently working on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (3-System Landscape) and developing a RAP application using Eclipse with ABAP Development Tools (ADT).

My requirement is to consume an external API (not based on database tables) within the RAP application and expose it as an OData service/UI.

Could you please guide me on the following points:

  • What are the steps required to consume an external API in a RAP application in the Public Cloud environment?

  • Are there any step-by-step guides or examples available for consuming APIs in RAP applications in the 3-system landscape?

Additionally, it would be very helpful if you could share best practices, required configurations, and sample code snippets related to API consumption in RAP for SAP Public Cloud.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,
Sanjay

entry.title: (RAP/Fiori) Currency Annotation/Formatting Not Applied for Action with Parameters in Fiori UI
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm encountering a specific issue where a currency field in a Fiori Elements UI is not being formatted correctly, but only when it's part of a parameter dialog for an parameter action.

The Problem:

I have an action that requires parameters, including an Amount and a Currency Code. In my abstract CDS view, I've set up the standard annotations to link the amount field to its corresponding currency code field, like this:




On the UI, when the action dialog opens, the 'Amount' field should automatically adjust its display and validation based on the selected currency. For instance, it should enforce two decimal places for currencies like USD or EUR, and zero for currencies like JPY or KRW.

The key issue is the lack of decimal place conversion. For example, if the currency is set to 'USD', entering a value of 100 is not automatically interpreted or displayed as 100.00. The UI treats it as a simple number, failing to apply the correct currency-specific precision.

This same annotation works perfectly for fields on our main List Report and Object Pages, but it seems to fail specifically within the context of an action's parameter dialog. I've already confirmed that both the amount and currency values are correctly passed in the OData payload.

Has anyone else faced this issue? Is there a known limitation or a different approach required for applying currency annotations to action parameters?

Any help or insight would be greatly appreciated.



Dear

@Andre_Fischer  
@MioYasutake 

I was wondering if you might have come across this specific behavior before. My apologies for the direct mention, but any insight you could provide would be incredibly helpful.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: RAP ABAP Runtime Error – CONVT_NO_NUMBER
entry.content:
Dear All,

While working in the RAP application, we are encountering the following ABAP runtime error: 'CONVERT_NO_NUMBER'.
This occurs when entering a value in the Attach ID field.

It appears the system is attempting to convert a non-numeric value into a numeric type, which is causing the issue. Kindly look into the data type handling or conversion logic in the relevant field or binding.

Your support in resolving this issue is appreciated.

 

 

but my field data type is char32. so please help.

entry.title: Unable to Deploy RAP application into Fiori launchpad in SAP public cloud(3SL)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have created a custom RAP application in Eclipse using a development tenant. The application is working fine in the service binding preview and is showing data correctly.

However, I am facing an issue when trying to deploy this RAP application to the Fiori Launchpad. I am unsure about the correct steps to make it available in the launchpad in the SAP Public Cloud (3-System Landscape).

Has anyone faced the same issue and successfully deployed a RAP application to the Fiori Launchpad? Any guidance or step-by-step instructions would be highly appreciated.

Regards,
Sanjay

entry.title: Fiori app is not saving data on CDS views
entry.content:
I have created a SAP UI5 app that is connected to my odata service. As of the moment I run it using NPM RUN START-LOCAL.

Why is that whenever I try to POST, the data posted was only saved on LOCALHOST:8000 and not on the mockdata file or in the CDS Views?

Manifest.json
"dataSources":{
 "mainService":{
  "uri":"/sap/opu/odata4/sap/zsd_api_zodata_v4/srvd_a2x/sap/zsd_api_zodata/0001/",
  "type": "OData",
  "settings": {
   "annotations": [],
   "localUri": "localService/mainService/metadata.xml",
   "odataVersion": "4.0"
  }
 }
}

 

Controller.js
var bRB1 = this.byId("rbTestRB1").getSelected();
var bRB2 = this.byId("rbTestRB2").getSelected();
var sSalesDoc = this.byId("salesDocInput").getValue();

var sType = "";
if (bRB1){
    sType = "Test RB1";
} else if (bRB2){
    sType = "Test RB2";
}

var oPayload = {
  RadioButton: sType,
  SalesDoc: sSalesDoc
};
//My entity name is ZSDOC
var oListBinding = oModel.bindList("/ZSDOC");
var oContext = oListBinding.create(oPayload);

oContext.created()
 .then(function (){
   console.log("Success", oContext);
})
 .catch(function (oError) {
  console.log("Error", oError); 
});

entry.title: RAP Custom Entity Deep associations
entry.content:
Hi there,

I composed a root custom entity Header which has a composition of 1 _to HeaderStart. Custom entity HeaderStart has a 1..* composition of _toLines. And the lines Custom Entity has a composition of _toDeliveryDetails. Custom Entity DeliveryDetails has a composition of one _toAddress Custom Entity.

Header->_toHeaderStart->_toLines->_toDeliveryDetails->_toAddress

i created a class and implemented the if_rap_query_provider. 

In my service i exposed all the entities. I created an odata v4 service

when i test my service via the gateway client I can only expand one level deep.

but i also want to expand to all other compositions but in one call starting from my root custom entity ZCE.

/ZCE(par1=‘1’,par2=‘2’)/Set&?expand=_toHeaderStart,_toLines,_toDeliveryDetails,_toAddress

in the debugger i come only two times in the select. But i want to deep nest further. Is this possible with custom entity?

I designed it like this because i need a nested json.

Any help or tips are appreciated.

Kind regards, 

#RAP#CustomEntity #Composition

#associations

entry.title: RAP Fiori Elements List Report Object Page HTML Control Cache Problem
entry.content:
Hi;

We have a RAP application consist of a list report and an object page with details and items sections. We extend the object page in BAS and added a custom section to the top of the object page. Later we added a sap.ui.core.HTML control to show a specific HTML content. Everything works fine. But when we click the navigation button on every line in the list report it adds the clicked HTML content on top of old HTML content. The HTML control does not clear the old content. I think it has a cache problem. We do some research and made some minor developments in BAS but no change. How can we clear the HTML control content right after we click the navigation button? Can you help us on this issue.?

entry.title: How to Dynamically Switch OData Services in SAP List Report Based on Filter Selection
entry.content:
I'm working with SAP Fiori Elements List Report application using the standard template (SAP UI5 version 1.96+). I have the following setup:

  • Service 1: /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZUI_SD_04_V2/ exposing entity set zc_header_04
  • Service 2: /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZUI_SD_LOG_04_V2/ exposing entity set zi_sd_04
  • Both services are configured in manifest.json as separate models

Requirement:

I have a custom filter bar (ComboBox) with two options:

  • Main - should display data from Service 1 (zc_header_04)
  • Log - should display data from Service 2 (zi_sd_04)

When the user changes the ComboBox selection, I want the List Report table to dynamically switch to the corresponding OData service and reload the data.

Current Implementation:

manifest.json:

 
 
json
"models": {
  "": {
    "dataSource": "mainService",
    "preload": true
  },
  "logModel": {
    "dataSource": "logService",
    "preload": true
  }
}

Extension Controller (ListReportExt.controller.js😞

 
 
javascript
onDataSourceChange: function (oEvent) {
    const sSelectedKey = oEvent.getSource().getSelectedKey();
    const oSmartTable = this.byId("listReport");
    
    if (sSelectedKey === "log") {
        oSmartTable.setModel(this.getView().getModel("logModel"));
        oSmartTable.setEntitySet("zi_sd_04");
    } else {
        oSmartTable.setModel(this.getView().getModel());
        oSmartTable.setEntitySet("zc_header_04");
    }
    
    oSmartTable.rebindTable();
}

Custom Filter Fragment:

 
 
xml
<smartfilterbar:ControlConfiguration key="CustomFilter">
    <smartfilterbar:customControl>
        <ComboBox id="dataSourceComboBox" selectedKey="main">
            <core:Item key="main" text="Main"/>
            <core:Item key="log" text="Log"/>
        </ComboBox>
    </smartfilterbar:customControl>
</smartfilterbar:ControlConfiguration>

Issues:

  1. When switching services, I get errors related to entity set not found
  2. The ComboBox selectionChange event is not triggering properly in the SmartFilterBar context
  3. Table doesn't rebind correctly after model switch

    can anyone help me

entry.title: Projection Veiw Error (could not parse DDL source for entity...)
entry.content:
Dear,  GURUs

I'm trying to learn RAP and create projection view following video instruction.

But there was a error and I couldn't activate the projection view.

Could anyone give a advice?

-----------

 

@ EndUserText.label: 'Header Projection View'

@AccessControl.authorizationChec #NOT_REQUIRED

@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotatio true

define root view entity ZC_SalesHdr10 as projection on ZI_SalesHdr10 as SalesHdr

{

key Salesorderuuid,

Salesorder,

Salesordertype,

Description,

Salesorganization,

Soldtoparty,

Distributionchannel,

Documentreason,

Totalnetamount,

Transactioncurrency,

Createdbyuser,

Creationat,

Lastchangedbyuser,

Lastchangedat,

/* Associations */

_SalesItem : redirected to composition child ZC_SalesItem10

}

-------------

Error Message : could not parse DDL source for entity ZC_SalesItem10

Thank you
